S�ren Vejrup Carlsen wrote:
>
> Hi there.
> I see, that your continued build program (cruisecontrol) generates a
> archive-commons-<version>.jar file.
> Are you planning to separate the code in archive-commons from the 
> crawler code itself?
>





For sure.  Intent is to refactor Heritrix code base into smaller, more 
coherent pieces.  We've been talking about it for a while now.

Currently, the archive-commons jar is made from the heritrix.jar using 
autojar (Seen the $HERITRIX_HOME/maven.xml for the autojar goal for how 
this is done).  Its done as part of the continuous build process.  
archive-commons.jar has in it the ARC reading and writing classes, our 
subclasses of the apache commons-httpclient URI class, and general 
utility from Heritrix all out of the org.archive package (nothing from 
org.archive.crawler package).  The archive-commons jar is then included 
in projects that juggle ARC files such as nutchwax and open source wayback.

Ahead of the breakup of the monolithic Heritrix jar, we should probably 
move from Maven 1.0.2 to Maven 2.0.  Maven 2.0 seems to like aggregating 
lots of small coherent jars to make up a big package, much more so than 
1.0.2.  We'll have to move source directories around inside the Heritrix 
source tree to make dedicated subprojects to build the likes of an 
archive-commons.jar and then a smaller Heritrix jar that has dependency 
on the former.  So we can have a history of the source code moves, and 
hopefully, so we can keep our CVS commit history, we'll preceed all by a 
move to subversion.

The above changes are large enough.  They should probably be done to 
coincide with release of Heritrix 2.0.  We need to work it into our plan 
(http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?HeritrixRoadmapFor2006).  
Will update the list when we've figured more on the above.


St.Ack
